ğŸŒ³Fun fact:
Tampines was named after the tempinis tree,which was found in the area.
Tampines Boulevard Park is nestled between new and upcoming housing developments and complements other green spaces in the area such as Tampines Eco Green, Sun Plaza Park and Tampines Park Connector.

I ran from Bedok Reservoir to check out the newly opened Tampines Boulevard Park, which just launched last week. The place has a great vibeâ€”open spaces, plenty of shaded spots, and a nice mix of greenery. I saw kids having fun at the playground, and some were even trying to fly kites, which added to the lively atmosphere.

Halfway through, I stopped by the ice cream shop in the middle of the park and grabbed a sea salt cone. It was just the right treat to cool down after the run. The park is a great addition to the areaâ€”perfect for a casual day out or just to relax.
It's officially opened and everyone is enjoying it! Even the pets are enjoying too! There's a water point for you to hydrate yourself ğŸ¥¤ğŸ˜ŠğŸ‘ğŸ¼

Those are millipedes in the Park, not centipedes. Millipedes are harmless.

Millipedes have two sets of legs per segment that are positioned directly under their body, while centipedes have one set of legs per segment, positioned to the side of their bodies. Centipedes also have a flatter body while millipedes have a more rounded body.
